column4: that's a lot, but linux performance with ntfs is not so good; better use another file system if you want to use it more than just accessing files (like using it with torrents, that's a bad idea with ntfs)
but I don't have enough space in my ext3 drives, should I format one of those ntfs s into ext3?
if you don't need to access them from windows, yes, definitely (also there is a windows tool to access ext3, but it will ask you to format it, beware)
